intro: Hieracium leucops, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers consist of a yellow disk surrounded by white ray florets. Hieracium leucops is often found in moist environments and can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies.
